abstract: A method and system providing a multi-memristive synaptic element for a cognitive computing system. The multi-memristive synaptic element comprises an array of memristive devices. The method comprises arbitrating a synaptic weight allocation, a related synaptic weight being represented by a synaptic weight variable of said multi-memristive synaptic element, updating said synaptic weight variable by a delta amount, and assigning said memristive devices to elements of a clock-like ordered circular list for selecting a particular memristor of said memristive devices requiring to be updated by a deterministic, periodic global clock that points to a different memristor at every clock tick, such that said multi-memristive synaptic element has a larger dynamic range and a more linear conductance response than a single memristor synaptic element.
summary: <SOH> SUMMARY <EOH>According to one aspect, there is provided a method for providing a multi-memristive synaptic element for a cognitive computing system. The multi-memristive synaptic element may comprise an array of memristive devices. The method comprises: arbitrating, by a programmed hardware processor, a synaptic weight allocation, a related synaptic weight being represented by a synaptic weight variable of said multi-memristive synaptic element, updating, using the programmed hardware processor, the synaptic weight variable by a delta amount, and assigning, by the programmed hardware processor, the memristive devices to elements of a clock-like ordered circular list for selecting a particular memristor of the memristive devices requiring to be updated by a deterministic, periodic global clock that points to a different memristor at every clock tick, running, by the programmed hardware processor, a reset clock, operating independently of the periodic global clock, for triggering a reset operation to be performed on a memristive device; such that the multi-memristive synaptic element has a larger dynamic range and a more linear conductance response than a single memristor synaptic element; and wherein a number of the ordered list of elements in the ordered circular list and an increment rate for the ordered circular list relate to each other in such a way that during consecutive iterations of selections at least one sub-element is different. According to another aspect, there is provided a multi-memristive synaptic element for a cognitive computing system. The multi-memristive synaptic element comprises: an array of memristive devices, as well as an arbitration module for arbitrating a synaptic weight allocation, the synaptic weight being represented by a synaptic weight variable of said multi-memristive synaptic element, an updating unit adapted for updating said synaptic weight variable by a delta amount, wherein said arbitration module is also adapted for ass...
title: MULTI-MEMRISTIVE SYNAPSE WITH CLOCK-ARBITRATED WEIGHT UPDATE
